sen.j: 鞍馬口通（くらまぐちどおり）は京都市内の東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Kuramaguchi-dori Street is an east -west running street in Kyoto City.
The Kuramaguchi-dori Street is a street running east -west through Kyoto City.
The Kuramaguchi-dori Street is a street running east-west through Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを消去

sen.j: 東は賀茂御祖神社西門から西は鹿苑寺門前の鏡石通まで。
sen.e: It extends from the western gate of Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine in the east to the Kagamiishi-dori Street. in front of Rokuon-ji Temple.
It extends from the western gate of Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine in the east to Kagamiishi-dori Street in front of Rokuon-ji Temple.
It extends from the western gate of Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine in the east to Kagamiishi-dori Street in front of Rokuon-ji Temple.

sen.j: これを北に折れるルートがかつての鞍馬街道である。
sen.e: The road bending north of its western end is the former Kurama kaido.
The road bending north of its western end is the former Kurama kaido.
The road bending north of its western end is the former Kurama kaido.

sen.j: 東鞍馬口通とは高野川 (京都市)の蓼倉橋手前の下鴨東通から下鴨神社西門まで中断している。
sen.e: The Higashi-Kuramaguchi-dori Street is divided between the Shimogamo Higashi-dori Street west of the Tadekurabashi over the Takano River (Kyoto City) and the western gate of Shimogamo Jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「蓼倉橋手前」は「蓼倉橋の西」と訳しました。
sen.e: Higashi-Kuramaguchi-dori Street is divided between Shimogamo Higashi-dori Street west of Tadekurabashi over Takano River (Kyoto City) and the western gate of Shimogamo Jinja Shrine.
Higashi-Kuramaguchi-dori Street is divided between Shimogamo Higashi-dori Street west of Tadekurabashi over Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) and the western gate of Shimogamo-jnja Shrine.
sen.cmt: Takano-gawa River, Shimogamo-jnja Shrineとしました。

sen.j: 平安京の範囲からは北に外れており、通りの西部は西陣の北部にあたる。
sen.e: The street is located outside the northern border of Heiankyo and the area along its western part is northern part of Nishijin.
The street is located outside the northern border of Heiankyo and the area along its western part is the northern part of Nishijin.
The street is located outside the northern border of Heiankyo and the area along its western part is the northern part of Nishijin.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉によって御土居が建設されたとき、現在の出雲路橋西詰付近に御土居の出入口（京の七口）の鞍馬口が設けられた。
sen.e: When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Odoi, an entrance of Odoi (Seven Entrances to Kyoto)--Kuramaguchi was established around the current Izumoji Bridge Nishizume.
When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Odoi, an entrance of Odoi (Seven Entrances to Kyoto)--Kuramaguchi was established around the current Izumoji Bridge Nishizume.
When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Odoi (earth enclosure), an entrance of Odoi (Seven Entrances to Kyoto) - Kuramaguchi was established around the current Izumoji-bashi Bridge Nishizume.
sen.cmt: ハイフン、スペースを修正、Izumoji-bashi Bridgeとし、「御土居」の補足を追加 (参照: http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=C05rs1pTM8AC&pg=PA75&dq=odoi+hideyoshi&as_brr=3&cd=3#)

sen.j: 江戸時代にはこの通りが洛中と洛外の境界とされていた。
sen.e: During the Edo era the street was regarded as the boundary between Rakuchu and Rakugai.
During the Edo era the street was regarded as a boundary between Rakuchu and Rakugai.
During the Edo period the street was regarded as a boundary between Rakuchu and Rakugai.

sen.j: 賀茂御祖神社（下鴨神社）
sen.e: Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine (Shimogamo Jinja Shrine)
Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine (Shimogamo Jinja Shrine)
Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine (Shimogamo-jinja Shrine)
sen.cmt: Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine, Shimogamo-jinja Shrineとしました。

sen.j: 上善寺 - 京都六地蔵の一 寺町
sen.e: Jozen-ji Temple - one of six Jizo of Kyoto - Teramachi
sen.cmt: 京都六地蔵の一つ と訳してあります。http://www5e.biglobe.ne.jp/~hidesan/jyozen-ji.htm
sen.e: Jozen-ji Temple - one of six Jizo of Kyoto - Teramachi
Jozen-ji Temple - one of six Jizo of Kyoto - Teramachi

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線 - 鞍馬口駅 烏丸通地下
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line - Karasumaguchi Station underground of the Karasuma-dori Street
Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line - Karasumaguchi Station underground of the Karasuma-dori Street
Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line - Karasumaguchi Station underground of the Karasuma-dori Street
Tankosha Publishing - a corner of Horikawa
Tankosha Publishing - a corner of Horikawa
Tankosha Publishing - a corner of Horikawa

sen.j: 鹿苑寺 - 木辻通、鏡石通角
sen.e: Rokuon-ji Temple - Kitsuji-dori Street, a corner of the Kagamiishi-dori Street
Rokuon-ji Temple - Kitsuji-dori Street, a corner of the Kagamiishi-dori Street
